list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: look keenly or with difficulty at someone or something.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: Blake screwed up his eyes, trying to peer through the fog
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Blake vặn lên mắt, cố gắng nhìn qua sương mù

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: make or become equal with or of the same rank.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: the Thames could not peer with the mill-streamlet close to my home
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Thames không thể ngang hàng với dòng mill-suối gần nhà tôi

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: a member of the nobility in Britain or Ireland, comprising the ranks of duke, marquess, earl, viscount, and baron.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: hereditary peers could still dominate the proceedings of the House of Lords
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Các đồng nghiệp di truyền vẫn có thể thống trị các thủ tục tố tụng của Hạ viện

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: a person of the same age, status, or ability as another specified person.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: he has incurred much criticism from his academic peers
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Ông đã phát sinh nhiều phê bình từ các đồng nghiệp học thuật của mình
